bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DIS- TRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of NG KWACK KANG, for a Writ of habeas corpus.
No. 3157 ORDER DIRECTING CLERK TO ISSUE WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

THIS MATTER having come on for hearing on the Petition of NG KWACK KANG, by and through his attorney of record, ADAM BEELER, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and it appearing to this Court from said Petition, which is on file that said NG KWACK KANG is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration, HENRY M. WHITE, or by some person or persons, acting by, through or under him; and that the said NG KWACK KANG, is imprisoned at the Detention House at the Immigration Station in the City of Seattle, King, County, State of Washington, and within the jurisdiction of the above entitled Court, and under the chrage that the said NG KWACK KANG is an alien and subject to the President of the Chinese Republic, and has no legal right to be admitted into the United States, and the COurt being fully advised of all the terms and allegations of said Petition, and of the contents thereof,

IT IS NOW, THEREFORE, ORDERED that the Clerk of this Court do issue a Writ of Habeas Corpus, requiring the said HENRY M. WHITE, United States Commissioner of Immigration, or such person or persons, acting by, through or under him, to have the body of the said NG KWACK KANG before this Court on the 15th day of Nov 1915, at the hour of Two o'clock PM.
DONE in open court this 11 day of Nov, 1915.
Jeremiah Neterer Judge U.S. District Court, in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
